document_data.name: The Baker's Daughter
document_data.mainbody: '''''The Baker's Daughter''''' was a love song about a [[silver dragon]] falling in love with a mortal woman, written and popularized sometime before [[1368 DR]].
document_data.History: In [[1368 DR]], ''the Baker's Daughter'' was performed by the god [[Milil]], the Lord of All Songs. He imposed the beautiful song on an audience of [[Sensates]] from [[Sigil]] who were performing a ''[[Scrying (spell)|scrying]]'' ritual to experience the forbidden experience of spying on [[Toril]]lian deities.
